intro: Antidesma hosei var. angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf antidesma, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
